docs.text: Home This site is to serve as a source for notes that will help new and veteran members keep track of all things FRC and 6502. Links Hardware and Parts Andy Mark : AM sells FRC Approved Parts. VEX Pro : VEX Pro REV Robotics : Rev Robotics Limelight : Easy vision using network tables. CTR Electronics : Provides FRC approved electronics. Guides WPILIB : This site provides a great start to finish guide for robot basics. It provides help with all hardware and software.
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Chief Delphi Chief Delphi is an online forum that has been around since the start of FRC. Create a username and find help with peers on Chief Delphi . IMPORTANT: Remember that you represent our team when chatting in open forums. Please use professional language and behavior. All communication between team members must be through our own tools like Microsft Teams.
docs.title: Chief Delphi

docs.text: NC FIRST Discord There is a discord server that provides a place for all FRC students in NC a place to chat. To join the server, use the link https://discord.gg/9XB7Wp9r . IMPORTANT: Remember that you represent our team when chatting in open forums. Please use professional language and behavior. All communication between team members must be through our own tools like Microsft Teams.
docs.title: Discord

docs.text: Github https://github.com/orgs/DurhamAcademy Github will be used to maintain robot code along with many other repositories that support the team. To join our private GitHub organization, send your username to Mr. Beck. If you need a GitHub account, sign up here .
docs.title: Github

docs.text: Kotlin Resources Kotlin is the programming language used to develop Robot code. For more information, see below: Working Demo Code Kotlin Introduction

docs.text: IntelliJ IntelliJ will be the primary IDE used to develop robot code. Be sure to install the FRC plugin under Settings/Preferences --> Plugins.
docs.title: IntelliJ

docs.text: IntelliJ will be the primary IDE used to develop robot code. Be sure to install the FRC plugin under Settings/Preferences --> Plugins.
docs.title: IntelliJ

docs.text: Jetbrains IDEs Jetbrains tools are used to develop code for the team. PyCharm is used for various Python projects IntelliJ is used to develop robot code with Kotlin/Java. Click here to create a student account using your DA email address. Student accounts created by DA email address are granted full access to all Jetbrains products for one-year. This can be renewed each year. Once an account is created, click here to get the Jetbrains toolbox which will install all Jetbrains products.
docs.title: Jetbrains IDEs
